content:
• Thursday, May 29, 2014
  • AVA

    Avista to sell Ecova unit to GDF Suez for $335M

    • Avista (NYSE:AVA) +5% AH after non-regulated subsidiary Avista Capital agrees to sell its Ecova unit, which provides expense management services for utility and telecom needs, to Cofely USA, a subsidiary of GDF Suez (GDFZY, OTCPK:GDSZF) for $335M.
    • AVA says it expects to use most of the proceeds to buy back stock and invest in its businesses.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • VEEV

    Veeva +6.2% AH on FQ1 beat, solid guidance

    • Veeva (NYSE:VEEV) expects FQ2 revenue of $68.5M-$69.5M and EPS of $0.07, above a consensus of $66.4M and $0.06. FY15 (ends Jan. '15) guidance is for revenue of $277M-$282M and EPS of $0.26-$0.28, above a consensus of $275.5M and $0.24.
    • Subscription revenue rose 74% Y/Y to $48.5M, easily outpacing rev. growth (+56% to $66.7M). Two new products - Veeva Align (life sciences resource management) and Veeva CRM Meetings (group meetings for healthcare professionals) are due to be released in calendar Q2.
    • Veeva's deferred revenue balance rose 11% Q/Q to $74.9M. GAAP opex rose 67% Y/Y to $28.2M.
    • Expectations were relatively low. JPMorgan's Wednesday coverage launch was well-timed.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDW

    Midway Gold -5% on news of $25M bought-deal offering

    • Midway Gold (NYSEMKT:MDW) -4.9%Â AH after a syndicate of underwriters agrees to buy 30.1M common shares at $0.83 each, raising ~$25M.
    • MDW says it intends to use the proceeds to fund the construction and working capital for the Pan project, Gold Rock development and permitting, and general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RTRX +22.1%. OVTI +18.8%. CVT +7.4%. WLT +5.9%. VEEV +5.7%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BLOX -29.3%. BNNY -16.9%. PSUN -9.9%. UQM -8.5%. GLUU -7.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision +18.4% AH on big FQ4 beat, strong guidance

    • OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) expects FQ1 revenue of $360M-$400M, far above a $304.9M consensus. EPS guidance of $0.29-$0.49 is largely above a $0.29 consensus.
    • The image sensor vendor says it has made "meaningful progress" in its efforts to diversify into new geographies (read: become less dependent on Apple), and to grow its automotive/security product sales.
    • Gross margin rose 50 bps Q/Q and 260 bps Y/Y in FQ4 to 20.1% thanks to sales of "newer and lower cost products." GAAP opex rose 12% Y/Y toÂ  $52.4M.
    • OmniVision, which currently has a market cap of $1.34B, ended FQ4 with $450.9M in cash and just $35.8M in debt. The company doesn't yet pay a dividend.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile -7.6% AH after announcing stock offering

    • Glu (NASDAQ:GLUU) hasn't yet disclosed the offering's size. Whatever it is, underwriters will have an overallotment option equal to 15% of offered shares. (prospectus)
    • Glu had $37M in cash at the end of Q1, and no debt. Last month, it announced plans to buy casual game developer PlayFirst for 3M shares and the assumption of $3.55M in debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • BNNY

    Annie's misses by $0.04, misses on revenue

    • Annie's (NYSE:BNNY): FQ4 EPS of $0.29 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $60.05M (+15.3% Y/Y) misses by $1.12M.
    • Shares -12.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • BLOX

    Infoblox guides light, CEO resigning; shares -26.5% AH

    • Infoblox (NYSE:BLOX) expects FQ4 revenue of $60M-$61M and EPS of $0.00-$0.02, below a consensus of $66.6M and $0.06. The guidance follows a big February warning, as well as a soft outlook provided in November.
    • The DNS/IP address appliance vendor says it "again experienced challenges in closing seven-figure transactions."
    • CEO Robert Thomas is resigning; a search has begun for a replacement. Thomas, who has held the top job for nearly 10 years, will "remain in his present management and board positions pending the appointment of his successor."
    • FQ3 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • UQM

    UQM Technologies EPS of -$0.04

    • UQM Technologies (NYSEMKT:UQM): FQ4 EPS of -$0.04.
    • Revenue of $1.0M.
    • Shares -4.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • OVTI

    OmniVision Technologies beats by $0.13, beats on revenue

    • OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI): FQ4 EPS of $0.40 beats by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $331M (-1.6% Y/Y) beats by $38.89M.
    • Shares +12.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk -6.3% AH on in-line FY15 guidance

    • Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK) expects FQ2 revenue of $92M-$94M, above a $91.6M consensus. But FY15 (ends Jan. '15) guidance is for revenue of $402M-$410M, which is only in-line with a $406.9M consensus. After many quarters of guiding above consensus, investors wanted more.
    • License revenue (drives future services revenue) grew 42% Y/Y to $51.3M. Services revenue grew 65% to $34.6M. 400+ customers were added, raising the total to 7.4K+.
    • FQ1 op. margin was -4.2%, above guidance of -8% to -10%. GAAP opex rose 84% Y/Y to $121.8M, with sizable increases in sales/marketing, R&D, and G&A spend.
    • Guidance for an FY15 op. margin of "approximately zero" is being reiterated. FQ2 op. margin is expected to be in the -2% to -4% range.
    • Splunk's deferred revenue balance rose 65% Y/Y to $194M.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • FWM

    Fairway Group misses by $0.11, beats on revenue

    • Fairway Group (NASDAQ:FWM): FQ4 EPS of -$0.21 misses by $0.11.
    • Revenue of $200.26M (+12.1% Y/Y) beats by $1.06M.
    • Shares +3.47% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • VEEV

    Veeva Systems beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Veeva Systems (NYSE:VEEV): Q1 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $66.7M (+55.9% Y/Y) beats by $3.3M.
    • Shares +1.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • PSUN

    More on Pacific Sunwear's FQ1

    • Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN) reports comparable-store sales rose 3% in FQ1.
    • Gross margin rate +100 bps to 26.1%.
    • Store count -20 to 618.
    • PSUN -1.4% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear of California beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Pacific Sunwear of California (NASDAQ:PSUN): Q1 EPS of -$0.11 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $171.14M (+2.9% Y/Y) beats by $0.4M.
    • Shares -1.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • EROC

    Eagle Rock up sharply after revamping credit agreement

    • Eagle Rock Energy (EROC +4.7%) is nearly 5% higher after securing amendments to its credit facility late yesterday, providing it with additional liquidity and certain covenant relief through the end of the current quarter.
    • The amendments, among other items, provides for an increase in the pipeline component of the facility's total borrowing base and also boosts the overall leverage ratio and senior secured leverage ratio during the three months ending June 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural target raised to $275 at FBR ahead of positive drilling results

    • Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +3.9%) powers higher after FBR Capital raises its price target to $275 from $250 to reflect expectations of positive drilling results.
    • FBR says its visit with the company added to its comfort with the existing assessment of material NAV and production growth upside for the platform; FBR believes production growth over the next three to five years could be materially higher than guidance and expectations.
    • Jim Cramer reminds viewers that PXD owns ~20K potential drilling locations, ensuring it can sustain high production growth rates for years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 3 Comments
  • FSLR

    Solar stocks bounce after SunEdison files for project IPO

    • SunEdison has filed an S-1 for its anticipated solar project spinoff. The spinoff, named TerraForm Power, will own a slew of SunEdison-built solar projects, while generating revenue (and distributing related cash flows) from electricity sale agreements.
    • The IPO might pave the way for other companies with sizable downstream project portfolios, such as First Solar (FSLR +2.8%), JinkoSolar (JKS +9.7%), and Trina (TSL +8.2%), to do spinoffs of their own. SunEdison's move comes after SolarCity (SCTY +5.6%) twice raised funds by selling solar asset-backed notes.
    • Solar stocks are following SunEdison higher (TAN +2.6%). In addition to the aforementioned companies, gainers include SunPower (SPWR +2.5%), Yingli (YGE +3.5%), Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4.6%), and Daqo (DQ +1.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • SC

    Santander Consumer May dividend could be the last for a while

    • The Fed last week told Santander Consumer USA (SC -5.4%) it didn't object to its May dividend of $0.15 per share as long as Santander (SAN -0.6%) contributes at least $20.9M of  capital to its U.S. holding company. Any further dividends will require Fed permission, and the company doesn't expect to submit a revised capital plan until January.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • MEET

    MeetMe rises after reporting of stronger app engagement

    • MeetMe (MEET +4.5%) claims the introduction of a Friend Suggestions feature for its iPhone app - part of a very competitive social networking/messaging app landscape - has boosted iPhone friend requests by over 60%, and total friend requests by 30%. The feature will be added to MeetMe's Android app in Q3.
    • Shares are recovering a small portion of the losses they've seen since a May 8 EPS miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • RESN

    Skyworks partner Resonant turns in a strong IPO

    • After pricing its 2.7M-share IPO at $6 (in-line with expectations), Resonant (NASDAQ:RESN) opened at $10 and is currently at $8.91, up 48.6%. That gives the RF filter developer a $57.7M valuation.
    • Resonant, still in development-stage, has developed filter technology (referred to as ISN) it asserts can both deliver improved performance and enable tunable designs (can cut down on a device's filter count and save space).
    • The company is looking to strike licensing deals that involve royalty payments for RF front-end modules using its IP. It had a Q1 net loss of $3.95M.
    • Resonant has a partnership with RF component giant Skyworks (SWKS +1.8%) to develop an RF duplexer it thinks can cost less than half as much as rival solutions. It also plans to develop tunable filter designs on its own.
    • Superconductor Technologies (SCON -0.7%) owns 11.6% of Resonant post-IPO.
    • Prospectus
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: ASTC +72%. XGTI +34%. VTUS +26%. DPW +22%. OTC:NLST +20%. RSH +17%. ICLD +17%. DVD +17%. HSH +16%. DGLY +15%.
    • Top 10 Losers: SPEX -38%. DARA -19%. TLYS -17%. PLCC -15%. GMAN -13%. NQ -13%. MNGA -12%. EVRY -10%. PRAN -8%. EVI -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Investors jump into Lions Gate ahead of earnings

    • Shares of Lions Gate (LGF +3.2%) jump to their highest level in two months in front of tonight's earnings release from the media company.
    • The quarter will include a contribution from the Divergent, The Legend of Hercules, and I, Frankenstein - although profit is forecast to have fallen from the year-ago period.
    • Earnings preview
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • TWER

    Towerstream +11.9% on Alcatel-Lucent deal

    • Towerstream (TWER) will provide Alcatel-Lucent access to "locations and services, including high-capacity backhaul, power, and mounting rights," to meet the needs of customers looking to install Alcatel's small cell base stations.
    • Alcatel is an early leader in the growing market for small cell base stations, which are typically deployed by carriers high-traffic settings such as train stations, malls, and stadiums.
    • Verizon and Sprint are among Alcatel's U.S. small cell customers.
    • Previous: Towerstream higher in spite of revenue miss, light guidance
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • SUNEQ

    SunEdison +9.1%; S-1 filed, name given for solar project spinoff

    • SunEdison (SUNE) has christened its solar project spinoff (formerly just known as YieldCo) TerraForm Power, and has filed an S-1. Goldman, Barclays, and Citi will act as the IPO underwriters.
    • TerraForm will trade under the symbol TERP, and will initially own projects (in the U.S., U.K., Canada, and Chile) with a nameplate capacity of 523.8MW. All of the projects have long-term power purchasing agreements attached; the average remaining lifespan is 18 years.
    • Between the IPO and the end of 2016, SunEdison will have to offer TerraForm solar projects expected to generate at least $175M in cash available for distribution within the first 12 months of their commercial operations dates.
    • SunEdison hasn't yet disclosed how large its stake will be post-IPO; it previously said it's looking to sell a 20%-30% stake, and raise up to $300M for new projects. The company added the spinoff is expected to pay a dividend.
    • The company's chip wafer unit turned in a moderately successful IPO last week.
    • Previous: YieldCo obtains $250M in financing from Goldman
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 6 Comments
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti jumps after launching $75M buyback program

    • At current levels, Ubiquiti's (UBNT +5.2%) buyback is good for repurchasing 2.4% of outstanding shares. The company had $292M in cash to pay for buybacks at the end of March, partly offset by $72M in debt.
    • The buyback comes after shares were crushed 3 weeks ago due to inventory and growth concerns that came in the wake of Ubiquiti's FQ3 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • VMW

    VMware gains as Piper upgrades, sees chance to "mow down Citrix"

    • "We see a solid set-up for a Q2 bookings rebound and more powerful multi-year product drivers than VMW has enjoyed in quite some time," writes Piper's Mark Murphy, upgrading VMware (VMW +2.7%) to Overweight.
    • Murphy adds a reseller survey points to "adoption rates moving to their highest level ever," and declares VMware has a better chance than investors realize to "mow down" PC virtualization leader Citrix (CTXS +0.1%), given product parity and talent defections.
    • VMware took fresh aim at Citrix last month by launching an integrated PC/app virtualization platform, and reported a 35% Y/Y Q1 increase in its end-user computing (inc. PC and mobile solutions) license bookings.
    • At the same time, the company posted sub-10% total bookings growth, as its standalone vSphere server virtualization sales come under pressure from Microsoft's Hyper-V and open-source offerings (inc. Citrix-backed Xen). VMware is counting on higher sales of its vCloud Suite (combines vSphere with cloud/data center management products) to help buck the trend.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • DHI

    D.R. Horton upgraded as Brookfield Residential is cut

    • Buy U.S. housing and sell Canada? RBC Capital makes a pair trade, upgrading D.R. Horton (DHI +0.6%) to Outperform while downgrading Canada-based Brookfield Residential Properties (BRP -2.1%) to Sector Perform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • WWAV

    Food stocks lively off of merger buzz

    • Shares of WhiteWave Foods (WWAV +4.6%), Dean Foods (DF +1.3%), and Sanderson Farms (SAFM +2.7%)Â are higher after Tyson Foods tops the bid of Pilgrim's Pride for Hillshire Brands.
    • Though consolidation in the food sector is expected to pick up, some analysts warn the takeover premium in select stocks is getting played out.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • XGTI

    xG Technology +62.9% after announcing new patent

    • xG Technology (NASDAQ:XGTI) has been awarded a new patent related to radio interference mitigation techniques.
    • xG argues the technology, which can lower "unwanted transmissions that lead to harmful interference," can be applied to mobile networks seeing greater interference issues as mobile data traffic surges.
    • On Tuesday, xG announced it has been awarded a cognitive radio patent that's also related to protecting against mobile interference. The company now has 116 awarded patents (51 U.S., 65 international).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • MELI

    Tech ratings changes: MercadoLibre, PT, HomeAway, Atmel, ePlus

    • MercadoLibre (MELI +3.8%) has been upgraded to Overweight by JPMorgan two weeks after agreeing to change its Venezuelan forex accounting.
    • Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD -2.2%) has been cut to Hold by Berenberg.
    • HomeAway (AWAY -5.3%) has been cut to Neutral by JPMorgan.
    • Atmel (ATML +2.2%) has been started at Outperform by ING.
    • ePlus (PLUS +1.2%) has been started at Outperform by William Blair.
    • Sabre (SABR +1.1%) has been started at Outperform by Bernstein. A long line of IPO underwriters launched coverage with bullish ratings on Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme-Bunge renewable oils plant begins commercial production in Brazil

    • Solazyme (SZYM +12.2%) surges at the open on news that its joint venture with Bunge (BG +1.1%) has successfully produced its first commercially saleable products on full-scale production lines at the renewable oils plant in Brazil.
    • SZYM says both oil and encapsulated lubricant products have been manufactured; production is continuing and expected to reach nameplate capacity within the next 12-18 months.
    • SZYM is now manufacturing products at three large scale facilities, including the 2K metric tons/year integrated facility in Peoria, Ill., the 20K/year Iowa facilities in Clinton/Galva and the 100K/year facility in Brazil.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 14 Comments
  • TLYS

    Tilly's craters on soft guidance, shares -25.5% premarket

    • Shares of Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS) are in meltdown mode after the specialty retailer sets guidance below expectations.
    • The outlook for FQ2 EPS is set by Tilly's at $0.03-$0.07 vs. $0.13 consensus on a high single-digit drop in comp sales.
    • TLYS -25.5% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: XGTI +47%. HSH +14%. PBMD +14%. SZYM +13%. PANW +13%. XXII +11%. ICPT +6%.
    • Losers: SPEX -28%. TLYS -26%. DARA -12%. SOL -7%. FN -6%. LIVE -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • DTEGY

    Report: DT accepts SoftBank/Sprint offer to buy T-Mobile

    • Japan's Kyodo news agency reports Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) has signed off on a SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF)/Sprint (NYSE:S) bid to acquire its 67% stake in T-Mobile USA (NASDAQ:TMUS).
    • DT has previously suggested it's open to a deal as SoftBank/Sprint worked to line up financing - in addition to T-Mobile's equity, a deal has to account for $8.7B in net debt.
    • But all signs suggest regulators remain wary of a tie-up lowering the number of nationwide U.S. mobile carriers to three, in spite of Masayoshi Son's relentless PR efforts.
    • TMUS +1.6% premarket. S +2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 10 Comments
  • TSN

    Food merger mania: Tyson Foods tops Pilgrim's Pride bid for Hillshire

    • Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) offers to buy Hillshire Brands (NYSE:HSH) for $50 per share.
    • The offer is over the top of a bid from Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC) for the company.
    • The news could hit shares of Pinnacle Foods (NYSE:PF)Â if it's left without a merger partner.
    • Food stock chain reaction (premarket): TSN +3.4% to $42.15; HSH +13.9% to $51.25, PPC -1.5% to $25.00; PF -1.8% to $31.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM | 4 Comments
  • ANF

    The squeeze is on at Abercrombie & Fitch

    • Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) are setting up for a short squeeze after the retailer showed some signs of life with its FQ1 report.
    • Traders have their eyes on volatility today with short interest at over 20% of shares outstanding.
    • On the fundamental side, A&F drove some traffic with promotions and managed to improve its inventory position in relation to other teen retailers. Though the company's margins dropped precipitously during the recent quarter, analysts had expected the annual guide to be a bit worse.
    • ANF +7.4% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • FRED

    Soft demand and mix shift plague Fred's in FQ1

    • Fred's (NASDAQ:FRED) reports comparable-store sales fell 1.9% in FQ1.
    • The company's gross margin rate fell 150 bps to 28.6% due to a shift by customers to lower-margin consumables.
    • SG&A expenses flat at $122.61M.
    • FRED -6.2% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 AM
  • TWTR

    Twitter gets another upgrade

    • There's more buying of the dip in Twitter (NYSE:TWTR) as Cantor Fitzgerald makes it two upgrades in two days.
    • Overvaluation, unrealistic expectations for growth, and the massive lock-up expiration were behind the stock's slump, says the team, but the overvaluation and lock-up have been dealt with. As for expectations, comparisons with Facebook's reach set an unattainable standard. "That said, we think Twitter shouldÂ show substantial revenue growth/margin expansion and generate meaningful returns to shareholders without having to mirror FB's model [or] approach its size," says Cantor.
    • SharesÂ +1.3%Â premarket after yesterday'sÂ 10.7% jump.
    • Previously: Twitter leaps after Nomura upgrade
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM | 3 Comments
  • ANF

    Guidance backed at Abercrombie & Fitch despite FQ1 margin slump

    • Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) reports comparable-store sales fell 4% in FQ1.
    • Sales by brand: Abercrombie & Fitch $317.8M; Abercrombie Kids $68.5M; Hollister $421.6M.
    • The company saw its stores and distribution expense rate plummet 270 bps to 50.8% in the quarter.
    • Gross margin fell 370 bps to 62.7%.
    • Inventory +6% Y/Y to $486M.
    • ANF +7.5% premarket after the company maintained its guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM
  • SPEX

    Spherix set for a gap down

    • Shares of Spherix (NASDAQ:SPEX) are downÂ 22%Â premarket on robust volume as evidence of the roller coaster profile of nano cap stocks. Prices more than doubled over the past several days in response to favorable U.S. legislative activities.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • COST

    Expenses clip Costco in FQ3

    • Costco (NASDAQ:COST) misses the EPS estimates of analysts with its FQ3 report as expenses rose faster than anticipated.
    • The company saw comparable-store sales increase 5% in the U.S. and 3% Internationally during the period.
    • Membership fees +5.6% to $561M.
    • Operating expenses +7.2% to $222.55B.
    • COST -0.9% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 AM
  • ICPT

    Intercept set for modest gap up

    • Shares of Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) are up 7%Â premarket on light volume in response to the FDA's fast track designation for OCA as a treatment for primary biliary cirrhosis.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM
